rev.comment: added small section: Windows To Go and Windows 8
rev.diff:
Line 170: Line 170:
===Windows Vista and Windows 7 ReadyBoost===
===Windows Vista and Windows 7 ReadyBoost===
In [[Windows Vista]] and [[Windows 7]], the [[ReadyBoost]] feature allows use of flash drives (up to 4 GB in the case of Windows Vista) to augment operating system memory.<ref name="test">{{cite web |first=Martin |last=Brinkmann |title=Windows 7 to Extend Readyboost |url=http://windows7news.com/2008/11/01/windows-7-to-extend-readyboost/ |publisher=Windows 7 News |date=2008-11-01 |accessdate=2009-05-12}}</ref>
In [[Windows Vista]] and [[Windows 7]], the [[ReadyBoost]] feature allows use of flash drives (up to 4 GB in the case of Windows Vista) to augment operating system memory.<ref name="test">{{cite web |first=Martin |last=Brinkmann |title=Windows 7 to Extend Readyboost |url=http://windows7news.com/2008/11/01/windows-7-to-extend-readyboost/ |publisher=Windows 7 News |date=2008-11-01 |accessdate=2009-05-12}}</ref>
  +   +
===Windows 8 and Windows To Go===
  +
[[Windows 8]] is planned to have a feature called [[Windows To Go]], wich will allow user to carry a bootable copy of Windows 8, alonside their documents and programs, in a USB drive.
